gr.forth.ics.util
Interface Interval

public interface Interval

An integer interval that is inclusive on both its ends.

Method Summary
 boolean contains(int integer)
          Returns whether the specified integer is included in this interval.
 int end()
          Returns the end of this interval.
 boolean isEmpty()
          Returns whether this interval is empty.
 int start()
          Returns the start of this interval.
 

Method Detail

start

int start()
Returns the start of this interval. If start() > end(), then this interval is empty;

Returns:
the start of this interval

end

int end()
Returns the end of this interval. If start() > end(), then this interval is empty;

Returns:
the end of this interval

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Returns whether this interval is empty. This is equivalent to start() > end().

Returns:
whether this interval is empty

contains

boolean contains(int integer)
Returns whether the specified integer is included in this interval. This is defined as: start() <= integer && integer <= end() .

Parameters:
integer - an integer
Returns:
whether the specified integer is included in this interval
